intro: Euchiton involucratus, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and are attractive to pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
